data.title: Good stuff
data.text:
Well prepared and flavorful. Some selections are close to what you would get in Mexico and are not too Americanized.

Unless you want an authentic Mexican eatery experience, get take out. The dining area is a bit grim.

data.title: Late lunch
data.text: The place was very empty when the two of us went for a late lunch. I think we had every waitress stop at our table at one point or another. The food was good and the service was nice.  I love their cabbage slaw that they bring out with the chips and salsa. The portions were large and the prices were pretty reasonable.

data.title: Excellent
data.text: If you want great authentic Mexican food with flavor this is the place!! Great margaritas! All four enjoyed our food!food! our

data.title: Best Mexican food around
data.text: Probably the best authentic mexican food in the Grand Valley, counter service only and limited hours, but worth it

data.title: Just your average Taqueria.  Only one downtown though.
data.text:
Been there several times over the years.  Nothing special, but that said, it's decent enough if you like taquerias.  I've never had a meal there that left me frowning.

It's pretty small, and parking can be difficult, especially if you have a big vehicle.  Unfortunately, they just don't have a lot of space to work with in the building or the parking lot.

Great that it's downtown if you are in the area.

data.title: A Hole-In-The-Wall with Great Food!
data.text: Don't look for atmosphere here, but DO expect excellent, homemade, authentic Mexican food!  I highly recommend the shredded beef tacos -- yummy without the greasiness of some Mexican food cafes.  This place fills up fast at lunch, so come early!

data.title: Favorite lunch spot
data.text:
I am taco lover!  And the tacos here are really superb.  Don't come here expecting Taco Bell, these are real deal Mexican tacos.  Served on small corn tortillas with your choice of chicken, pork, steak or barbacoa and topped with fresh cotija cheese, lettuce, onion, cilantro & tomato.
Everything is made to order and they have an open kitchen so you can see (and smell!) that its all homemade.  
They offer quesadillas, tamales, taco salads and more plus all flavors of Jarritos soda, Coke products etc.
You can eat here for less than $10 and be FULL.  I am here for lunch at least twice a month, big fan!

data.title: Good Mexican Food
data.text: Really a hole-in-the-wall sort of place (the best kind), with some really great food. Best Mexican food we've found in Junction so far. We will definitely be coming back here a lot. Had some tacos and smothered tamales. Looking forward to trying the whole menu.

data.title: Love the smothered burrito!
data.text: Excellent service!  The smothered burrito is so delicious!  Good prices.  A small restaurant gem!   I highly recommend giving it a try.  You'll be hooked.

data.title: Clean, Good and Fast
data.text: This place is a great unassuming little authentic Mexican Taqueria.  The kind of place that you can imagine started as a food truck or taco stand and was so popular they built four walls around it. It is a small place with just a few tables. Order at the counter and watch the women in the back assemble your food. The menu is small and authentic and listed on a board above the counter Authentic tacos with a variety of meats from asada, barbacoa, to lingua and buchea. Tacos $1.75 .  Clean, good and fast.
